message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient and her husband are both carriers of a mutation in the ATP7B gene, which is associated with Wilson's disease. This is an autosomal recessive disorder, meaning that the chance of an affected child is 25%. There is a 50% chance that the child will be a carrier like the parents and a 25% chance that the child will not inherit the mutation.
